description.narrative: The Strengthening Pre-Service Teacher Education in Myanmar (STEM) Phase II project aims to improve Myanmar’s pre-service teacher education system through policy and institutional capacity development in Myanmar’s 25 Teacher Education Colleges (ECs). The Project will provide technical support to the Ministry of Education for the reform of the pre-service teacher education system. Expected outcomes include: improved enabling environment for teacher policy and teacher education reform; new competency-based teacher education curriculum and policies in line with international standards, human rights, gender equality, and teacher rights; the supply of high quality, specialized, primary and middle school teachers that meet the demands of diverse learners in Myanmar; and improved human resource and financial management systems that support the implementation of an updated competency-based degree. STEM is contributing to both the upstream and downstream work of improving pre-service teacher edu
